function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'func' to reach function 'printf'?
Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'func'?
Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'func'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i<=n' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i<=n' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'i < argc' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i < argc' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i<=n' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < argc' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'n (line 2)' affect subsequent computations?
Is variable 'sum (line 4)' used after its definition?
liveness: Does variable 'sum' remain in use at the end of function 'func'?
Does variable 'n' remain in use at the end of function 'func'?
dead_code: Is the statement 'for (int i = 0; i < argc; ++i)' unreachable?
Is this statement not dead: “int i;”?
